title: Add Web Share API for native sharing
description:

- Users must manually attach images after pasting

title: Add WebLLM Writing Assistant to intake form
description:
## Goal
Integrate browser-based LLM (WebLLM) into intake form to help users generate "Did You Know?" content with minimal effort.

## Current State
- Users must write content from scratch
- No AI assistance available
- High friction for content creation
- Goal is minimal human-in-the-loop automation

## Tasks
- [ ] Research WebLLM integration (runs locally in browser)
- [ ] Add "AI Generate" button to intake form
- [ ] User enters topic/URL, AI generates Did You Know content
- [ ] AI suggests appropriate hashtags
- [ ] Model downloads on first use, cached thereafter
- [ ] Loading state while model initializes

## Acceptance Criteria
- User enters topic like "Healthcare Pathways"
- AI generates 2-3 sentence "Did You Know?" fact
- AI suggests relevant hashtags
- Works entirely in browser (no API keys needed)
- Progressive enhancement - form works without AI too

## Technical Notes
- Consider WebLLM or Transformers.js
- Small model (Phi-3-mini, Llama-3.2-1B) for fast loading
- System prompt includes MSDE brand guidelines

title: MSDE Network: Allow outbound to huggingface.co for WebLLM
description:
## Issue
WebLLM requires downloading AI models from huggingface.co. On MSDE network, this domain is being redirected/blocked:
- DNS resolves to ::1 (localhost) or 10.84.15.36 (internal IP)
- Results in SSL_PROTOCOL_ERROR when WebLLM tries to load

## Solution
Request MSDE IT to whitelist outbound HTTPS (port 443) to:
- `huggingface.co`
- `cdn-lfs.huggingface.co` (for large file storage)

## Workaround
Until fixed, users on MSDE network can:
1. Use personal hotspot/home network for first-time model download
2. Model caches in browser - works offline after initial download
3. The FAQ fallback still works without WebLLM

## Technical Details
- WebLLM model: Llama-3.2-1B-Instruct-q4f32_1-MLC (~500MB)
- One-time download, cached in IndexedDB
- No data sent TO huggingface - only downloads model weights

title: Consider upgrading to PocketFlow architecture for chatbot
description:
## Current State
CTE Month chatbot uses a simpler inline implementation:
- Static siteKnowledge string with page context
- Single WebLLM backend with FAQ fallback
- No mode switching or progress tracking

## PocketFlow Pattern (from pythonLearn)
More sophisticated Node-Graph architecture:

### Key Components
1. **GetContextNode** - Extracts page context via window.location.pathname
2. **BuildPromptNode** - Dynamically builds system prompt based on context
3. **CallLLMNode** - Handles LLM interaction with error handling
4. **FormatResponseNode** - Processes and formats responses

### Features to Consider
- **Learning Modes**: Guide (Socratic) vs Solution (Direct explanations)
- **Multiple AI Backends**: WebLLM, Ollama, OpenAI-compatible APIs
- **Progress Tracking**: Track user interactions, completed tasks
- **Dynamic Prompts**: System prompt changes based on current page/section

### Implementation Path
1. Create js/tutor-flow.js with PocketFlow Node/Flow classes
2. Create js/tutor-ui.js for UI management
3. Update HTML to use modular tutor component
4. Add settings panel for mode/backend selection

### Reference
- /Users/willf/learnPython/js/tutor-flow.js
- /Users/willf/learnPython/js/tutor-ui.js
- /Users/willf/three-d-printing/js/tutor-flow.js

## Trade-offs
- More code complexity vs current simple implementation
- Current FAQ fallback works well for basic help
- Consider if advanced features are needed for CTE Month use case

title: Real-time language translation for posts and chat
description:
## Goal
Enable real-time translation of social media posts and chat responses to support Maryland's diverse communities.

## Use Cases
1. Translate generated posts to Spanish, French, Chinese, etc.
2. Allow users to chat with the bot in their preferred language
3. Create multilingual versions of the same post for broader reach

## Implementation Options

### Option A: Browser-based (WebLLM - already in use)
- Use existing WebLLM infrastructure
- Add translation prompts to the model
- Pros: No API costs, works offline
- Cons: Model size, translation quality

### Option B: Cloud Translation API
- Google Cloud Translation API
- AWS Translate
- Azure Translator
- Pros: High quality, many languages
- Cons: API costs, requires backend

### Option C: LibreTranslate (Self-hosted)
- Open source translation
- Can run on Cloudflare Workers
- Pros: No per-request costs, privacy
- Cons: Setup complexity

## Suggested UI

### For Posts
```
[Generate Post] [Translate ▼]
                 ├─ Spanish
                 ├─ French  
                 ├─ Chinese (Simplified)
                 ├─ Korean
                 └─ More...
```

### For Chat
```
Language: [English ▼] 
          ├─ English
          ├─ Español
          ├─ Français
          └─ 中文
```

## Priority Languages for Maryland
1. Spanish (largest non-English population)
2. Chinese (Mandarin/Cantonese)
3. French (including Haitian Creole)
4. Korean
5. Vietnamese
6. Tagalog

## Tasks
- [ ] Research: Compare translation API options and costs
- [ ] Design: Add translation UI to intake.html
- [ ] Backend: Set up translation endpoint if using cloud API
- [ ] Frontend: Implement language selector
- [ ] Testing: Verify quality with native speakers
- [ ] Accessibility: Ensure RTL language support (Arabic, Hebrew)

## Related
- Supports MSDE's equity and access goals
- Complements MOA (Methods of Administration) equity initiatives

title: Direct Social Media Posting with OAuth
description:
## Goal
Enable users to post directly to Twitter/X, LinkedIn, and Instagram from the toolkit after creating a post, using secure OAuth authentication.

## Current State
- Users create posts in intake.html
- Posts are copied manually to clipboard
- Users must paste into each social platform separately

## Target State
After generating a post, users can:
1. Click "Post to X" / "Post to LinkedIn" / "Post to Instagram"
2. Authenticate once via OAuth (tokens stored securely)
3. Post goes live with one click

## Security Requirements (CRITICAL for MSDE/Gov context)
- [ ] OAuth 2.0 with PKCE flow (no client secrets in browser)
- [ ] Tokens stored server-side or in secure backend
- [ ] Never expose API keys in client-side code
- [ ] Implement token refresh and revocation
- [ ] Rate limiting to prevent abuse
- [ ] Audit logging for compliance

## Architecture Options

### Option A: Serverless Functions (Recommended)
- Use Cloudflare Workers, Vercel Edge Functions, or AWS Lambda
- OAuth callback handled server-side
- Tokens encrypted at rest
- Minimal infrastructure to maintain

### Option B: Backend Service
- Dedicated Node.js/Python service
- More control, more maintenance
- Better for complex workflows

### Option C: Third-Party Service
- Use Buffer, Hootsuite API, or Zapier
- Fastest to implement
- Less control, potential costs

## Platform-Specific Notes

### Twitter/X
- API v2 with OAuth 2.0 PKCE
- Free tier: 1,500 posts/month
- Requires approved developer account

### LinkedIn
- OAuth 2.0 with 3-legged auth
- Requires Company Page admin access for org posts
- Personal posts easier to implement first

### Instagram
- Requires Facebook Business account
- Instagram Graph API via Facebook
- Most complex OAuth flow

## Sub-Tasks
- [ ] Research: Evaluate architecture options
- [ ] Setup: Create developer accounts for each platform
- [ ] Backend: Implement OAuth flow handler
- [ ] Frontend: Add "Post to..." buttons to intake.html
- [ ] Security: Implement token storage and refresh
- [ ] Skills: Create Claude Code skills for posting workflow
- [ ] Testing: End-to-end testing with test accounts
- [ ] Docs: User guide for connecting accounts

## Skills to Create
1. `/connect-social` - Guide through OAuth setup
2. `/post-to-x` - Post current content to Twitter/X
3. `/post-to-linkedin` - Post to LinkedIn
4. `/post-to-instagram` - Post to Instagram
5. `/disconnect-social` - Revoke tokens safely

## Related
- Existing chatbot can guide users through the flow
- Consider PocketFlow for posting workflow (cte-month-2026-6pm)
